channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Citizen crime app shifts to testing a private security on demand feature
item.description: The app formerly known as Vigilante is reportedly testing a feature that summons a "personal rapid response service" on-demand.

item.title: Judge in Epic vs. Apple presses Tim Cook on why so many developers are unhappy
item.description: Tim Cook testified about Apple’s developer policies, the company’s business in China and its privacy policies.

item.title: Twitch adds a dedicated 'Hot Tubs' category
item.description: Twitch has added a dedicated "Pools, Hot Tubs and Beaches" section.

item.title: Apple TV 4K can use HDMI eARC to play any TV audio on your HomePod
item.description: If you have a HomePod and picked up the new Apple TV 4K, your speaker will make for a better home theater companion than it did before. As noticed by MacRumors, the latest Apple TV 4K supports the ARC (Audio Return Channel) and eARC (enhanced ARC) standards over HDMI. What this means in practice is that the Apple TV 4K can wirelessly send all audio from your television to a HomePod (or stereo pair of HomePod speakers).

item.title: Samsung won't abandon Tizen in favor of Android TV
item.description: "Tizen still is the default platform for our smart TVs going forward," a spokesperson for the company told Engadget.

item.title: DARPA helped make a sarcasm detector, because of course it did
item.description: Researchers from the University of Central Florida worked with DARPA to create a deep learning AI capable of understanding written sarcasm with a startling degree of accuracy.

item.title: How Apple built the new iPad Pro's Liquid Retina XDR display
item.description: 5G. The M1 chipset. Loads of RAM. Thunderbolt support. All of these help make Apple’s new, 12.9-inch iPad Pro an almost startlingly capable tablet, one that seems well-equipped to compete against more traditional laptops. (Well, apart from iPadOS’s limitations, anyway.) But if there’s one area where the iPad Pro clearly outshines the rest of Apple’s portable computers, it’s that screen.

item.title: The popemobile is going all-electric thanks to Fisker
item.description: The EV maker is building a custom vehicle based on its Ocean SUV.

item.title: Microsoft's plan to improve meeting rooms includes larger displays and spatial audio
item.description: Microsoft has shared a new video detailing how it sees its Teams software fitting into hybrid work models.

item.title: Twitter explains how Ticketed Spaces will work for paid events
item.description: Twitter shared more details on its upcoming Ticketed Spaces feature.

item.title: Moog's iOS synth apps are all free right now
item.description: Minimoog Model D, Model 15, Animoog and Filtatron are all available at no cost.

item.title: Developer reveals Xbox Easter Egg after waiting nearly 20 years for people to find it
item.description: This week, a developer who worked on the original Xbox contacted Kotaku to tell the website how to trigger the Easter Egg.

item.title: Ford received almost 45,000 F-150 Lightning pre-orders in under 48 hours
item.description: Demand for electric trucks isn't slowing down anytime soon.

item.title: RAI's certification process aims to prevent AIs from turning into HALs
item.description: The Responsible Artificial Intelligence Institute hopes to offer a more standardized means of certifying that the AIs of tomorrow operate fairly, transparently, and safely.

item.title: This week's best deals: $100 off Apple's Mac Mini M1 and more
item.description: This week's best tech deals include $100 off Apple's Mac Mini M1, $200 Apple's MacBook Pro M1 and $30 off the Roku Streambar.

item.title: Dating apps offer free credits and other perks to vaccinated users
item.description: The White House has teamed up with Tinder, OkCupid and seven other dating sites.

item.title: Snap is buying the company that made AR displays for its new Spectacles
item.description: Snap is buying WaveOptics, the company behind the displays in its Spectacles glasses with built-in AR.

item.title: These advanced wireless earbuds are on sale for under $95
item.description: ComfoBuds Pro give you excellent sound quality that you can customize based on your environment.

item.title: Spotify users can finally download music on Apple Watch
item.description: Spotify on Apple Watch finally supports music downloads, putting offline music on your wrist without requiring Apple Music.

item.title: Mass Effect’s Normandy starship is coming to 'No Man's Sky'
item.description: The crossover prize is yours if you take part in the Beachhead expedition by May 31st.

item.title: Fujifilm GFX 100S review: Medium format power in a smaller body
item.description: Fujifilm GFX 100S looks and feels like a “normal” mirrorless camera, while costing a bundle less at $6,000.

item.title: China says TikTok's creator and LinkedIn are violating data privacy laws
item.description: China regulators have shamed TikTok creator ByteDance, LinkedIn, and other companies for allgedly abusing their collection and use of app data.

item.title: Apple's 512GB MacBook Pro M1 is $200 off right now at Amazon
item.description: Amazon knocks $200 off Apple's MacBook Pro M1 with 512GB of storage.

item.title: Facebook's latest AI can learn speech without human transcriptions
item.description: Facebook has developed a machine learning system that can recognize speech without the need for transcribed data.

item.title: The US Federal Reserve begins looking into its own digital currency
item.description: The US Federal Reserve is took a step toward developing a digital currency as it announced plans to publish a research paper on the subject.
